<!--e57a25ab6845829454e8d69fc972939a-->

The following sections might be updated with supplementary metadata relevant to reviewers and maintainers.

<!--021abf342d371248e50ceaed478a90ca-->
### Reviews
See [the guideline](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#code-review) for information on the review process.
| Type | Reviewers |
| ---- | --------- |
| ACK | [john-moffett](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/17127#issuecomment-1419398876) |
| Concept ACK | [laanwj](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/17127#issuecomment-541577626), [practicalswift](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/17127#issuecomment-867112447) |
| Stale ACK | [jonasschnelli](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/17127#issuecomment-635868123), [willcl-ark](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/17127#pullrequestreview-1238693018) |

If your review is incorrectly listed, please react with ð to this comment and the bot will ignore it on the next update.
<!--174a7506f384e20aa4161008e828411d-->
### Conflicts
Reviewers, this pull request conflicts with the following ones:

* [#26863](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/26863) (test: merge banning test from p2p_disconnect_ban to rpc_setban by brunoerg)

If you consider this pull request important, please also help to review the conflicting pull requests. Ideally, start with the one that should be merged first.
GetDataDir, a getter, is not the place to do things such as set the umask. Please don't add these kind of side-effects.
please use `mode_t` instead of int here, that's the argument type for umasks
Concept ACK on removing `-sysperms`.

Maybe `GetDataDir` is not a proper name for this function as it already has an intended side-effect:
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/ddd3cd30cb050fe9b8738778beecba1d8bd50d52/src/util/system.cpp#L777-L780

I know. I kind of want to get rid of that too. But don't add any more

(edit: also  I think setting `umask` is the *worst* kind of side effect possible, it's global state of the program over all threads)

@laanwj 
Thank you for your review. All your comments have been addressed.
Done.
Done.
<!--cf906140f33d8803c4a75a2196329ecb-->Needs rebase
Rebased after #17138 has been merged.
Wouldn't `SetupEnvironment` be the right place for this? Or is that too early?

Currently, `SetDefaultUmask()` is called just before the first possible disk write.

`SetupEnvironment()` seems too broad, as it is called in utilities too. And, yes, I think it is too early. But I could be wrong ;)
But does that matter? What would be the consequences of setting it too early? Why wouldn't we want to set the umask for the utilties?

> Wouldn't `SetupEnvironment` be the right place for this?

Agree.
@laanwj Thank you for review. Your comment has been addressed.
@promag Would you mind reviewing this PR?

Rebased ef8ed07715f90bc156a4d4015ea1db9ee975963d -> 9b105d7289a793eaa30ae8fe7937b1356969758b ([pr17127.10](https://github.com/hebasto/bitcoin/commits/pr17127.10) -> [pr17127.11](https://github.com/hebasto/bitcoin/commits/pr17127.11)) due to the conflict with #20744.
PR description has been updated.

@willcl-ark 
> The test datadir will have the following files created in it after node shutdown:
> 
> banlist.json, debug.log, fee_estimates.dat, mempool.dat, peers.dat, settings.json
> 
> Would it be worth adding a permissions test for e.g debug.log to check that the correct umask is also being applied to files?

Sorry, but I didn't quite get your suggestion. Mind elaborating it?

> Sorry, but I didn't quite get your suggestion. Mind elaborating it?

My fault for not being clearer!

You added a test for [directory permissions](https://github.com/hebasto/bitcoin/blob/20191013-permissions/test/functional/feature_fs_permissions.py#L19-L23), but not not one for files. As files and folders will be created with different permissions,  it might make sense to add this at the same time?

For directories the test covers `datadir` and `walletsdir`. For files I was suggesting we could test `debug.log`.
This also fixes https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/issues/22595

Updated 9b105d7289a793eaa30ae8fe7937b1356969758b -> 07c496d01b7ab03451b1d8278cef2652540ff191 ([pr17127.11](https://github.com/hebasto/bitcoin/commits/pr17127.11) -> [pr17127.12](https://github.com/hebasto/bitcoin/commits/pr17127.12)):
- rebased
- addressed @willcl-ark's [comment](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/17127#issuecomment-1332405771)

Is there a reason to add 10 lines here, and another `#ifndef`, instead of putting the 2 lines of code where they are actually used? i.e why not just:
```cpp
#ifndef WIN32
    constexpr mode_t private_umask = 0077;
    umask(private_umask);
#endif
```
in `SetupEnvironment()`?

Updated 07c496d01b7ab03451b1d8278cef2652540ff191 -> 15c7105a2ddc720ed0cac0fe7995755cad437880 ([pr17127.12](https://github.com/hebasto/bitcoin/commits/pr17127.12) -> [pr17127.13](https://github.com/hebasto/bitcoin/commits/pr17127.13)):
- rebased
- addressed @fanquake's [comment](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/17127#discussion_r1063355778)
Thanks! [Updated](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/17127#issuecomment-1417887067).
In system.cpp now, right?
system.cpp
